column2: *They brought the monster to one of the cargo holds and set up a direct connection to the bridge.*
Great. Ahem. Can you hear me?

I can. *The creature looks up at the camera. It's talking loudly, obviously thinking that you can hear it better that way.* What do you want from me? *It really does look more like a Klisk alive than its comrades when they were dead. If you took a normal Klisk, made it four times as big, grew its muscles until they looked grotesque, and threw a hide of a different color over all that, you would get this monster. Although, can you really call it that?*
Who are you?
Why did you want my people to kill you?
Are you confused by where you are?
What was that writing on the walls of your lair?
Do you know there are others like you?
This might surprise you, but we were looking for you.
What do I do with you now?
*The creature hugs itself and rocks side to side.* I don't know. I don't remember anything.
What do you mean?
As far as I can remember, I spent all my life on that planet. A very long time. And then you came. That's it.
Why did you want my people to kill you?
Are you confused by where you are?
What was that writing on the walls of your lair?
Do you know there are others like you?
This might surprise you, but we were looking for you.
What do I do with you now?

So tired. Always alone, always alone. *The creature points at its head.* And there... very bad. *Now it points at its chest.* Here, too. Better all the time, it's unbearable. I wanted to kill myself, but I can't. I thought you would.
This is very strange. I expected a lot of things, but definitely not this.
*No response.*
Who are you?
Are you confused by where you are?
What was that writing on the walls of your lair?
Do you know there are others like you?
This might surprise you, but we were looking for you.
What do I do with you now?
It's a space ship. What's wrong with it?
And how do you know that?
*The creature opens its mouth. Then the creature closes it. It falls silent and retreats into itself.*
Who are you?
Why did you want my people to kill you?
What was that writing on the walls of your lair?
Do you know there are others like you?
This might surprise you, but we were looking for you.
What do I do with you now?
Poetry. Sometimes it appears in my head. And I write it down. And then I forget it again. That's why I write it down.
What was that poem?

I... *It frowns.* I forgot it. I remember what it was about. About how tired I was. That I only have what I have in my head, what I think about. I'd like to throw everything I have at someone's feet, someone I can talk to. But all I have is what's inside my head.
Who are you?
Why did you want my people to kill you?
Are you confused by where you are?
Do you know there are others like you?
This might surprise you, but we were looking for you.
What do I do with you now?
I knew that. But I forgot. Now I remember. They weren't like me, you're wrong. They couldn't… do what I did. *It frowns and rubs its forehead.*
You're right. We couldn't talk to them, they attacked my people and we had to defend ourselves. But how could you know that?
It's just inside my head. That's that.
Who are you?
Why did you want my people to kill you?
Are you confused by where you are?
What was that writing on the walls of your lair?
This might surprise you, but we were looking for you.
What do I do with you now?
Really? Why?
You were created by a scientist who wasn't a very good person. He sent those like you to different planets. And we were sent after them. To solve the problem.
Yes. I see. I must be a problem. I remember a long time ago, where I lived, small and big things lived. *Tries to depict something with its hands.* I ate them. Then I ran out.
Who are you?
Why did you want my people to kill you?
Are you confused by where you are?
What was that writing on the walls of your lair?
Do you know there are others like you?
What do I do with you now?
What do you do with me?
They sent us to kill you. But you're sentient. That would have been very unethical.
Oh. Ethical… unethical… I think I… Understand. *It hugs itself again and starts rocking back and forth.*
I could hand you over to those who sent us. They're practical, but not evil. They could find a way to help you. Do you want that?
I could leave you here, aboard my ship. Do you want that?
Oh… What are they like?
Klisks? They're like you, just smaller. You're very much alike.
Strange. Something is itching in my head… *It rubs its forehead.* There, inside. But I wouldn't mind that.
Then it's decided.
There is another way.
Oh?
I could hand you over to those who sent us. They're practical, but not evil. They could find a way to help you. Do you want that?
I could leave you here, aboard my ship. Do you want that?
Oh. Stay here? And… who are you? And why?
We're humans from planet Earth. We explore space to save our planet. Sometimes we help other peoples. I don't know how you could help us, but you definitely could do it somehow.
Humans. Very interesting. *Rubs its nose.* I think I could help. I… I know…
Of course you could. Stay. We'll find a place for you.
There is another way.

Yes... No... You don't understand. *It rubs its nose again.* I didn't mean I knew that... it's different... *The monster shudders, and suddenly says in one breath...* Hexatomic structures allow synthesis of nucleotides that are alternative to ribo- and deoxyribonucleotides. Ribo- and deoxynucleotides, nucleotides containing hexose residue, can be bound to each other forming various polynucleotide chains. That... that...
Is that something from chemistry? What is it?
*The monster doesn't respond. Rocking side to side more and more, in the end it relaxes fully and drops to the floor.*
Damn it. Gordon, send a science team to the cargo hold with our new friend! And medics, I guess…
